channel.title: Dodgy Knees and Dirty Balls
channel.itunes:subtitle: Regular ramblings from the Dodgy Knees and Dirty Balls team about everything in the world of sport. If you've got any comments or questions for us to talk about you can find us on Twitter (@dodgykneesblog) or email us - podcast@dodgykneesanddirtyballs....

channel.description: Regular ramblings from the Dodgy Knees and Dirty Balls team about everything in the world of sport. If you've got any comments or questions for us to talk about you can find us on Twitter (@dodgykneesblog) or email us - podcast@dodgykneesanddirtyballs.com.

item.title: Lako Je Sve - Just The Three Of Us
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss in great and meaningful depth the upcoming Euro 2012 tournament in Poland and Ukraine.
From the Group A (the unfancied GROUP OF DEATH) to Group B (the ACTUAL GROUP OF DEATH) through Group C (the Mediterranean group) and finishing on Group D (just a normal group).
Who will win? Who will be victorious?! Who will be left depleted and dumped into the footballing abyss?! And will ZLATAN RULE THEM ALL?!

item.itunes:summary:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss in great and meaningful depth the upcoming Euro 2012 tournament in Poland and Ukraine.
From the Group A (the unfancied GROUP OF DEATH) to Group B (the ACTUAL GROUP OF DEATH) through Group C (the Mediterranean group) and finishing on Group D (just a normal group).
Who will win? Who will be victorious?! Who will be left depleted and dumped into the footballing abyss?! And will ZLATAN RULE THEM ALL?!

item.title: Sir Galahad Of IKEA
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss the end of King Kenny's reign at Anfield and some potential replacements as well as the oh-my-gosh-amazing end to the Premier League season. There's a quick farewell to a few legends around Europe before they get their teeth into the England squad announcement for Euro 2012.
It's not just Football though (only 97.4%) as they guys discuss the latest revelation in the career of Samoan Rugby player Eliota Fuimaono-Sapolu and the Chief celebrates a long awaited return to winning ways for Williams F1.

The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss the end of King Kenny's reign at Anfield and some potential replacements as well as the oh-my-gosh-amazing end to the Premier League season. There's a quick farewell to a few legends around Europe before they get their teeth into the England squad announcement for Euro 2012.
It's not just Football though (only 97.4%) as they guys discuss the latest revelation in the career of Samoan Rugby player Eliota Fuimaono-Sapolu and the Chief celebrates a long awaited return to winning ways for Williams F1.

item.title: The Gentrification of Boreham Wood FC
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) are back after a bit of a break to discuss the business end of the Premier League along with all the excitement and heartbreak of promotion and relegation throughout the Football League.
There's a look ahead to the FA Cup final plus some discussions on financial fair play along with a final update of the season on our beloved Boreham Wood FC.
There's even a nose into the latest happenings in the world of Tennis. Jesus.

item.title: Cwtchy Cwtchy
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss the latest Premier League and Football League action with a candidate for goal of the season, Everton reaching the magic 40 points, Liverpool's wonderful demise, a Demba and Demba bromance, West Ham's special tactics and Di Canio's madness.
There's also some F1/Mario Kart chat and the return of Who The Dodgy Knees Am I?

item.title: Come On, Come On, It's Called The U-Turn
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss the latest Premier League and Football League action including goal line technology, relegation battles and goalmouth scrambles. Also, how good is Lionel Messi?! There's some rugby chat as Wales make it 4 from 4 and the English RFU continue to blunder their way through the manager selection process.
To top it off - it's the return of the quiz as Tom defends his title!

To top it off - it's the return of the quiz as Tom defends his title!

item.title: Va Va Voom All Over My Room
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss the latest Premier League action, Charlton continuing to steam roller League One and the missed opportunities (not) in the latest England squad. There's also a win for Boreham Wood (ALL ABOARD), a Triple Crown for Wales in the Six Nations and some chat about the mixed fortunes of the England (and Wales!) Cricket team.
Most importantly, it's the return of Patrik Berger's Beautiful Bastards and the induction of a silky Frenchman.

item.title: Abracadabra! Backstreet's Back, Alright?
item.description: The Dodgy Knees(ers) return to discuss the latest FA Cup action from the weekend, the plight of Portsmouth and Rangers and get an update on their beloved Boreham Wood FC (All aboard!!). The guys chat about the latest embarrassment for British boxing, take a look at next weekend's Six Nations matches and play a bit of Who The Dodgy Knees Am I?

item.title: All-Time Premier League XI: Part II
item.description: The Dodgy Knees(ers) return with part two of their special Premier League XI podcast. After selecting the Goalkeeper and back four in part one it's now time to pick the midfield and strikers - a far from easy task! What do you think on the final XI? Agree? Disagree? Let us know!

After selecting the Goalkeeper and back four in part one it's now time to pick the midfield and strikers - a far from easy task! What do you think on the final XI? Agree? Disagree? Let us know!

item.title: All-Time Premier League XI: Part I
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return with a special two-part podcast where they select their best ever Premier League XI. In this first installment the Goalkeeper and back four are discussed and finalised.
Look out for part two next week! Agree? Disagree? Let us know!

item.title: Pink Gills and Middle Legs
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) discuss the latest weekend's action throughout English football and drop in for an update on their beloved Boreham Wood FC (All aboard!!).
There's also a preview of the upcoming Australian Open and the grand unveiling of an exciting new feature - Patrik Berger's Beautiful Bastards.

item.title: Race, Rules and Rematches
item.description: The Dodgy Knees(ers) discuss the latest FA Cup third round and the ridiculous rules around player and manager celebrations. Not ones to avoid the sensitive matters, we give our views on the Liverpool race row and discuss the latest controversy in Boxing.

item.title: False Starts - Do You Rate Them?
item.description: The Dodgy Knees(ers) discuss each of their teams seasons so far and targets for the remainder of the season while Evo decides he doesn't rate, well...anyone? There's a bit of chat about some possible transfer targets, an update on our beloved Boreham Wood FC and there's even a bit of tennis for a change.

item.title: Little Bird, Big Squirrel, Jon Parkin? JESUS!
item.description: The Dodgy Knees(ers) come together for the final podcast of 2011. They round up the latest sporting news as usual but somehow struggle to remain serious throughout. As a fitting finale to they year - the Dodgy Knees Quiz Champion 2011 is crowned as the team pit their wits against the quiz-master.

item.title: So Long, Farewell, Auf Wiedersehen...AWOOGA!
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) pay their respects to two of Football's greatest midfielders along with one of Rugby's finest wingers. There's a roundup of the latest Premier League, Championship and FA Cup action along with a quick look ahead to the Champions League.
Also features a return for 'Who The Dodgy Knees Am I?'
RIP Gary Speed and Socrates.

item.title: Chuckle Chants For Ipswich
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) check in on their adopted team Boreham Wood,check out the credentials of the teams at the top of the Premier League and there's a quick farewell to the voice of Football, Tim Gudgen. The guys also peruse the recent Heineken Cup results and play a little game about a birthday boy.
Apologies for the sound of Tom singing - he insisted.

item.title: The Roeder Rat Strikes Back - All Aboard The Boreham Bus!
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) peruse the Football League from top to bottom from St James' Park, through the Valley and on to Boreham Wood. They teach you the art of horse racing and check out the usual sporting news and Twitter funnies.
Hero of the Week: Billy Sharp

item.title: Rugby World Cup Special: Stever Rider - See You Next Tuesday
item.description: The Dodgy Knees(ers) return with a special podcast to select their team of the tournament for the Rugby World Cup. They pick the first XV along with a subs bench, a coach, a very important kicking coach, a referee, a stadium, two commentators, a presenter and a team of studio pundits.

item.title: Strip Scrabble With A Three-Way
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) learn why you have to strip in World Championship Scrabble and discuss the latest football news along with a round-up of this weekends Premier League results and the Rugby World Cup final.
Respects to Dan Wheldon and Marco Simoncelli.

item.title: Dumpy Little Men
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) get excited about the return of Pele and take an in depth look at the Rugby World Cup knockout stages including the 'quality' commentary and coverage of them over the weekend.
Also features more 'Championship Manager Legends' - Pauleta and Tommy Svindal Larsen.

item.title: Men Are Like Venus and Caro Likes Rors
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) return with more chat about recent events in the Premier League and Rugby World Cup plus some alternative views on Rory Mac and Venus Williams.
Also includes more 'Championship Manager Legends' - Kim Kallstrom, Bosko Balaban and Taribo West.

item.title: Balotelli Pork Balls and Cleverley's Not Even a Pizza!
item.description:
The Dodgy Knees(ers) chat about the opening weekend in the Rugby World Cup, the Premier League fates of Everton and Liverpool and Wales' revival under Gary Speed.
Also includes 'Championship Manager Legends' and 'Takeaway Squads'.
